Package org.opensextant.giscore.output

Class FeatureSorter

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.output.FeatureSorter
public class FeatureSorter extends Object
The esri formats require that the features be sorted into uniform bins where the attributes and the type of geometry involved is homogeneous. This class takes care of the sorting of features into temporary files that hold a uniform set of features, and which allows the consumer to then get the features back out by category.
Author:
DRAND

    • getSchema

      public Schema getSchema(Row row)
      A row may either have a reference to a known schema or data that is not governed by a schema. The assumption here is that the extended data will only belong to a single schema, either ad hoc or explicit.

      This code assumes that local references to a schema involve schemata that have already been read. External references will result in the creation of a dummy schema object with an appropriate name.

      Names of the schema are urls, either fragments, which reference local schemata, or full urls, which reference non-resident schemata.

      Parameters:
      row - the row
      Returns:
      the referenced schema, never null but keep in mind that internal schemata may be returned.

    • add

      Get bounding area if the features are geometry
